name: CA268 Toodle Remote Access
body:
##PuTTY set up:
*  Download [PuTTY](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html)
*  Run putty.exe
* In the 'Category' section, select 'Connection>SSH>Tunnels'
* 
   1. Type "8080" in the source port
   2. Underneath, select Dynamic and Auto
   3. Click 'Add'
* In the 'Category' section, select 'Connection>SSH'
* Tick the 'Don't start a shell or command at all' box.
* In the 'Category' section, select 'Session' at the top.
* Enter the host name (\<username\>@student.computing.dcu.ie) and port (22)
* Select SSH as the connection type underneath.
* Save the configuration under any name you like.

##Chrome set up:
* Create a second shortcut to chrome.exe
* Right click it and select properties.
* In the 'Target' field, add 
    --proxy-server="socks5://127.0.0.1:8080"
  on to the end after the path to chrome.exe.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
